parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire tread separation or failure can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: outer running surface coming off the tire

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear camshaft seal can cause oil to leak onto the exhaust system, leading to a potential fire hazard, and can also cause engine damage if not addressed promptly.
symptoms: Oil leaking onto the exhaust system
smoke or burning smell while driving

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the water pump can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, and can also cause coolant to leak onto the road, potentially causing accidents.

The failure of the motor mounts can cause excessive engine movement, leading to premature wear on other engine components, and can also cause vibrations that can be felt in the cabin, affecting vehicle comfort and safety.
Unintended acceleration in reverse gear can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, property damage, and potential injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle suddenly accelerates in reverse gear
causing loss of control and potential damage to property and other vehicles.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Unstable or erratic transmission shifting can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, property damage, and potential injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle surges or accelerates unexpectedly when shifting into reverse or drive
the transmission hesitates or slips before engaging
the vehicle lurches or jerks when shifting gears.
